author: Staff Reporter
text:
Principal District Judge R. Poornima on Tuesday adjourned the temple pujari suicide case till January 25 as the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court reserved its judgment in the case seeking appointment of a lawyer instead of special public prosecutor to argue the case in the Dindigul court.

Three of the seven accused in the case – Manimaran, Logu and Sivakumar – appeared before the court on Tuesday.

Lawyers expressed hope that the High Court would pronounce its judgment on appointment of a lawyer before the next hearing.

Minister’s brother

Police registered cases against O. Raja, brother of Finance Minister O. Paneerselvam, and six others – Thenkarai town panchayat chairman Pandi, Manimaran, Loganathan, Sivakumar, Gnanam and Saravanan – in connection with the suicide of S. Nagamuthu (22) of T. Kallupatti village, a Dalit.

Nagamuthu, who was working as pujari at Sri Kailasanathar Hill Temple in Periyakulam, committed suicide by hanging on December 8, 2012, after he was allegedly subjected to harassment.
title: Temple pujari suicide case adjourned
